snippet: Advocates worry about how prosecutors will apply a sweeping law decreed by the new military-backed president as a tool to fight terrorism....

headline.print_headline: Human Rights Groups in Egypt Brace for Crackdown Under New Law
headline.main: Human Rights Groups in Egypt Brace for Crackdown Under New Law

lead_paragraph: Advocates worry about how prosecutors will apply a sweeping law decreed by the new military-backed president as a tool to fight terrorism.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

abstract: Rights activists in Egypt say new law enacted by military-backed Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi is sign that Egypt is becoming more repressive police state; law, intended to fight terrorism, imposes potential life sentence for any crime interpreted as harmful to country.
